extendedInfo.description: The Melbourne International Film Festival (MIFF) is an iconic Melbourne event. MIFF Hosts a feast of cinematic delicacies from over 50 countries for seventeen days each Winter, and is heavily garnished with a range of parties and special events that cast a celebratory mood over the city. The Festival is one of Australia's most significant public events. The MIFF2013 app lets you: Explore the program: - Browse the program by name, date, venue, country, category and director - Browse âWhatâs Onâ at the festival daily - Find out whether sessions are Selling Fast or Sold Out â try not to miss out! - Read event information and watch film trailers- Find your way around Melbourne with maps for Venues and Dining Partners- Love it? Hate it? Rate it! Vote in the MIFF People's Choice Award presented by Foxtel Movies for your chance to win daily prizes by mattt bags Buy and download tickets: - Buy tickets securely with your credit card anywhere, anytime - Buy passes and redeem films immediately - Go paperless: download tickets to be scanned at the cinema door Schedule your attendance and share with friends: - Create a shortlist of events through Wishlist - Share events through email, Twitter and Facebook - Share your ticketed sessions with friends through email - Map your nearest MIFF Food & Film partners and access special offers - Get the latest festival news straight to your phone - Follow the festival through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, Tumblr and YouTube feeds Left your printed tickets at home? If you buy tickets using the same MIFF account details, you can retrieve all the barcodes on your device regardless of how you purchased (counter, web or phone). These barcodes can be scanned on your device for entry at the cinema door. About the developers: Ferve Tickets has been working with festivals in Australia for the last decade, setting up customized ticketing systems to deliver a smooth, stress-free festival experience â for both staff and customers.

reviews.title: Faulty
reviews.comment: ACCOUNT SIGN UP DOESNT WORK, WILL NOT ALLOW TEXT INPUT...
reviews.author: Tyler Brady

reviews.title: Works well
reviews.comment: Did everything I needed well. One minor improvement would be the ability to share short listed films with friends so that we can see what we both want to see.  Thanks.
reviews.author: Scott Watson

reviews.title: Great, we\'ll put together app
reviews.comment: Very happy with the experience I\'ve had wit this app. Has worked really well, I\'ve bought several tickets without issue and the wish list functionality has been great. Being able to browse, wish list, purchase and ticket I the one place is great. More apps should be like this.
reviews.author: Ben Thomas

reviews.title: Great on new
reviews.comment: At first, I was very disappointed because this didn\'t work very well on my old phone, bit now it\'s perfect.
reviews.author: Chris Mardiryan

reviews.title: Works Well
reviews.comment: No problems on Motorola RAZR and Nexus 7 tablet. Functional and straight forward to use. Developers responsive to feedback.
reviews.author: Richard Purdy

reviews.title: Underwhelming
reviews.comment: The design language on this app is pretty awful. It\'s also inconsistent with holo principles. It\'s very difficult to navigate back in menus as the \'back\' button leaves the app from all screens
reviews.author: Rian Chubb

reviews.title: Great app!
reviews.comment: People who 1 star an app because it is bugged on their device are idiots. Contact the developer for support and don\'t trash the rating of an app that is genuinely one of the best I\'ve seen for a festival.  So quick and easy to manage your tickets!!!
reviews.author: Jimmie Martin

reviews.title: Always logs me out
reviews.comment: Seems to have issues on android - logs you out once you leave the app even if you select automatic login then refuses to log in when you need to produce your ticket for scanning. Basic function fail.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pretty good
reviews.comment: The only thing missing is the ability to rate the films I have seen. If it had this feature it would be perfect for me. Paperless tickets are still great though. I always seem to run out of ink in the home printer, and can\'t be bothered lining up at the box office.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome Concept
reviews.comment: Love the paperless ticket system. And the ability to search by movie title and date in the program then buy tickets. Would be great if it kept me signed in and allowed me to make and view  film ratings
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good MIFF companion app, but some issues
reviews.comment: Serves basic functions well, but continually loses cache data, cache images appears in my gallery - but definitely the worst feature... no film vote button despite it existing on the iphone version! Please fix!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Miff 2012 app!!!
reviews.comment: Love the app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Samsung Note not supported
reviews.comment: Works on my iPhone, my iPod touch, a SGII but fails to work on my Samsung Note. YMMV.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Functional
reviews.comment: Actually very frustrating... of course it\'s just an ios app... back button doesn\'t work and it makes my screen feel so small!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Nice app
reviews.comment: Love the buy ticket and  paperless features.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Miff 2013 app
reviews.comment: Simple, functional, easy to use
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love the app
reviews.comment: Very easy to buy ticket
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: HTC
reviews.comment: Malfunctioning. Always has to force close when updating data.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: Fantastic!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Frequently freezes
reviews.comment: Difficult to use.
reviews.author: Kate Frost
